intro: Acroceras manongarivense, commonly known as the Manongarivé starwort, is a rare and endemic flowering plant native to the high-altitude grasslands of the Andes in southern Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are usually pale blue to violet, and it produces small, elongated fruits known as cypselae. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
